intro: Pistia commutata, commonly known as water lettuce, is a floating aquatic plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It has rosette-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a fuzzy appearance. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically yellow or green in color. It thrives in still or slow-moving freshwater environments. Due to its rapid growth, it can become invasive in some areas, impacting local ecosystems.
